net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy
Class AbstractTCPProxyEngine

java.lang.Object
  net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy.AbstractTCPProxyEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, TCPProxyEngine
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTTPProxyTCPProxyEngine, PortForwarderTCPProxyEngine
public abstract class AbstractTCPProxyEngine
extends Object
implements TCPProxyEngine

Base class for TCPProxyEngine implementations.

Author:
Phil Dawes, Philip Aston, Bertrand Ave

Nested Class Summary
protected  class AbstractTCPProxyEngine.FilteredStreamThread
          Runnable which actively reads an input stream and writes to an output stream, passing the data through a filter.
protected  class AbstractTCPProxyEngine.OutputStreamFilterTee
          Filter like class that delegates to a user filter and tees the result to an output stream.
protected  class AbstractTCPProxyEngine.StreamThread
          Wrapper for handling stream threads.

Constructor Detail

AbstractTCPProxyEngine

public AbstractTCPProxyEngine(TCPProxySocketFactory socketFactory,
                              TCPProxyFilter requestFilter,
                              TCPProxyFilter responseFilter,
                              Logger logger,
                              EndPoint localEndPoint,
                              boolean useColour,
                              int timeout)
                       throws IOException
Constructor.

Parameters:
socketFactory - Socket factory for creating our server and client sockets.
requestFilter - Request filter.
responseFilter - Response filter.
logger - Logger.
localEndPoint - Local host and port to listen on. If the EndPoint's port is 0, an arbitrary port will be assigned.
useColour - Whether to use colour.
timeout - Timeout for server socket in milliseconds.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Method Detail

stop

public void stop()
Stop the engine and flush filter buffer.

Specified by:
stop in interface TCPProxyEngine

isStopped

public boolean isStopped()
Check whether this engine is stopped.

Returns:
true => the engine is stopped.

run

public abstract void run()
Main event loop.

We do not implement InterruptibleRunnable as we are not designed to be interrupted. If we are, code will throw an UncheckedInterruptedException - effectively an assertion.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

getStreamThreadGroup

final ThreadGroup getStreamThreadGroup()
Allow unit tests to access the ThreadGroup to be used for stream handling threads.

Returns:
The thread group.

accept

protected Socket accept()
                 throws net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy.AbstractTCPProxyEngine.NoActivityTimeOutException,
                        IOException
Accept a connection using our server socket. Blocks until a connection is accepted.

Returns:
The client socket.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
NoActivityTimeOutException - If the accept timed out, and we have no active threads handling connections.
net.grinder.tools.tcpproxy.AbstractTCPProxyEngine.NoActivityTimeOutException

launchThreadPair

protected final void launchThreadPair(Socket localSocket,
                                      EndPoint remoteEndPoint,
                                      EndPoint clientEndPoint,
                                      boolean isSecure)
                               throws IOException
Launch a pair of threads to handle bi-directional stream communication.

Parameters:
localSocket - Local socket.
remoteEndPoint - ConnectionDetails. The remote EndPoint to forward output to. This is also used in the logging and filter output.
clientEndPoint - The EndPoint to be used in the logging and filter output. This may well differ from the localSocket binding.
isSecure - Whether the connection is secure.
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

logIOException

protected final String logIOException(IOException e)
Log IOExceptions.

Parameters:
e - The exception.
Returns:
A description of the exception.
